intro: Phaca hornii, commonly known as the horned phaca, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, branched, and often hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Due to habitat loss, Phaca hornii is considered endangered, making it a subject of conservation interest.
